definition: to make a copy (and send it to someone)/Cc (for email)/Carbon Copy (for email)
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: It was from Shannon McDonald. cc: Frank Davis.
sentences.chinese: 新邮件来自夏侬麦当娜，并抄送了弗兰克戴维斯。

sentences.english: I didn't set you on CC.
sentences.chinese: 我没有把你设置到抄送。

sentences.english: Be cautious with your use of CC; overuse simply clutters inboxes.
sentences.chinese: 也不要随意乱用抄送，不然会造成对方收件箱的混乱。

sentences.english: Copy of application approved by general manager shall be made for financial director.
sentences.chinese: 总经理批准的呈批件必须抄送财务负责人。

sentences.english: CC-ing a rock e-mail could be dangerous for an entire village.
sentences.chinese: 一封石头邮件的“抄送”可能会对整个村落造成危险。

definition: to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
to approve and forward/to endorse/stamp "approved for distribution"
to submit (a report etc)/to refer (a problem) to sb
to issue (a memorandum etc) to lower levels/to distribute (e.g. disaster relief to victims)
to return to one's original trade/to put (a business etc) under the administration of the relevant central authority/(the) relevant (department in charge of sth)
to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
